Hi guys, we were just thinking on what wheels to put on our robot, just wondering what other teams are doing this year.we are doing a 6 wheel tank drive and just thinking on what wheel to use. Thanks!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T21:40:01.487Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":172.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":424067,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-wheel-for-the-2023-season","display_username":"Nemo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/c/f/cf7c608ba45f508066fc6ccacae80a326feb3200.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12862,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-wheel-for-the-2023-season/424067/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130833,"name":"Lexeo","username":"Lexeo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lexeo/{size}/160041_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T21:52:06.547Z","cooked":"

I like to keep it simple personally. The white hi grip wheels from Andymark work great.

In 2018 4272 tried to get fancy with the alternative hi-grip materials (colors) , but it just ended up causing more issues than it helped. It didn’t give us any real advantage.

If I were to get a little fancy. I personally would throw omnis in the corners. This will make it so you can turn a little faster.

If I were going really crazy, I think an all omni drive would have some advantages this season. With the full field runs it would make it difficult for other robots to slow you down because they can’t t-bone you. That said, this could get a little “interesting” on the charging station so if you were crazy enough to try this, be ready to go back to a traction wheel.

For our 6 wheel tank drive, our team is going with the 6" Plaction Wheels with Rough top Tread from Andymark and 6" Omni Wheels from Vex on the front (for us, we are defining “front” as the scoring side).

The AM taction wheels that come with the kit bot would also probably be a safe bet for this game as mentioned a little further back in this thread.

andymark.com

6 in. Plaction Wheel with Blue Nitrile Tread

6" Plaction Wheel w/ Roughtop Tread
